intro: Lotononis secunda, commonly known as the silver leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like white flowers with yellow centers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and ragworts. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and rockeries.
